alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued August 21 at 11:15AM PDT until August 22 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CALDOR WEST BURN SCAR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall from thunderstorms continue to be possible over the Caldor West burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Motherlode and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...This afternoon and evening. * IMPACTS...Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall over the Caldor West burn scar are expected up to and during the period of the watch. The heaviest rain is expected between 4 PM and 8 PM. Residents near the Caldor West burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Caldor West burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
